benchmark_details.name: SIFT-50M (Speech Instruction Fine-Tuning)
benchmark_details.overview: SIFT-50M is a 50M-example dataset designed for instruction fine-tuning and pre-training of speech-text large language models (LLMs) covering five languages with diverse speech understanding and controllable speech generation instructions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Facilitate instruction-following for speech-text LLMs and improve generalization to unseen instructions.

data.source: Publicly available multilingual speech data sources including Multilingual Librispeech, Common Voice, and VCTK.
data.annotation: Generated by LLM from augmented metadata.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on responses to instruction tasks compared to baseline models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance on instruction-following and generation tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: SIFT-LLM outperforms existing speech-text LLMs on instruction-following benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Utilized feedback loop and quality assurance processes during data generation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Dataset constructed from publicly available corpora.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Dataset is created with diligence to limit potentially harmful uses.
